info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 10:19PM EDT until June 20 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past several days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston.
* WHEN...From Thursday morning to late Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 34.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 32.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 35.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.3 feet on 01/04/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING
